ЁЯСС
Nedunchezhiyan

Reign: c. 210 CE (Sangam Era)
He is known as the 'Victor of Talaiyalangadu'. At a young age, he defeated an alliance of seven rulers, including the Chola and Chera kings. In the epic 'Silappatikaram', he is the same king who mistakenly sentenced Kovalan to death and later, upon learning the truth, sacrificed his life on the throne.

тЪФя╕П
Jatavarman Sundara Pandya I

Reign: 1251тАУ1268 CE
He is considered the greatest ruler of the second Pandya Empire. He established Pandya supremacy throughout South India by defeating the Cholas, Hoysalas, and Kakatiyas. He gilded the Srirangam temple and bore the title 'Emandalam Konda Aruliya' (the one who conquered all regions).

ЁЯУЙ
Decline

The civil war over succession in the early 14th century weakened the state, which was exploited by Malik Kafur (general of Alauddin Khilji) who invaded and plundered Madurai. After this, Pandya power declined.
